lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
Manage your daily tasks with GigaDuke
There are 3 types of Tasks in GigaDuke
- ToDo: for tasks with no timestamp
- Deadline: for tasks that need to be finished by a certain time
- Event: for tasks that occur at a certain date and time
Have the ability to mark completed tasks as done.
You can also choose to un-mark tasks that you marked as completed.
You can delete tasks from your task list if you no longer need it.
You can see all your tasks at once.
You can filter your tasks list to see only tasks that match certain keywords.
You have the option to update Deadline and Event tasks timestamps.
All your tasks are automatically saved after every command.
They will be loaded in everytime you re-start the application.
Adds a Todo Task to the GigaDuke task tracker.
A message indicating the Todo task has been successfully added.

Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Adds a Deadline Task to the GigaDuke task tracker.

Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Adds an Event Task to the GigaDuke task tracker.
A message indicating the Event task has been successfully added.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
A message indicating the task has been successfully marked as completed.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
A message indicating the task has been successfully marked as uncompleted.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Removes the task from GigaDuke task tracker.
A message indicating the task has been successfully deleted.
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
A message showing all the tasks in task tracker.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Displays all tasks that match the keywords.
A message showing all the tasks that match the keywords.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Updates the timestamp of certain tasks.
A message indicating the task has been successfully updated to the new timestamp.
OK, I've updated the task to:
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!

* @return A boolean indicating if program is ending.
* An Exception class for Duke related problems.
* @param message The message to be shown when DukeException is caught.
* Returns the message from a DukeException.
* Command to add a Task to the TaskList.
* @param task The Task to be added.
* Task will be added to TaskList, data will be updated and saved, message will be printed to user.
* @param tasks The list that contains all the Tasks on the program.
* @param ui Deals with the interaction with user.
* @param storage Deals with the loading and updating of file.
* @return The String response of Duke after running command.
* @throws IOException If there is an error when updating the file.
public String run(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws IOException {
* Command to end the Duke program.
* Command will be set to end the program.
* @param tasks The list that contains all the Tasks on the program.
* @param ui Deals with the interaction with user.
* @param storage Deals with the loading and updating of file.
* @return The String response of Duke after running command.
public String run(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Abstract class representing commands that Duke program can run.
* Each and every other command will inherit from Command super class.
* Executes the Task, data will be updated and saved, message will be printed to user.
* @param tasks The list that contains all the Tasks on the program.
* @param ui Deals with the interaction with user.
* @param storage Deals with the loading and updating of file.
* @return The String response of Duke after running command.
* @throws IOException If there is an error when updating the file.
public abstract String run(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws IOException, DukeException;
* Sets the isEnd variable to true.
* Duke program will end upon variable being set to true.
* Checks if the command ends the program.
* Command to delete a Task from the TaskList.
* @param num The index of Task in TaskList to be deleted.
* Task will be deleted from TaskList, data will be updated and saved, message will be printed to user.
* @param tasks The list that contains all the Tasks on the program.
* @param ui Deals with the interaction with user.
* @param storage Deals with the loading and updating of file.
* @return The String response of Duke after running command.
* @throws IOException If there is an error when updating the file.
public String run(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws IOException, DukeException {
throw new DukeException("Task list is already empty.");
assert this.num >= 0 : "Index of Task to be deleted has to be at least 1.";
assert this.num < tasks.getSize() : "Index of Task to be deleted has to be less than size of Task list.";
* Command that filters out TaskList and prints out those with matching keywords.
* Command will be set to filer TaskList to those that match keyword.
* @param tasks The list that contains all the Tasks on the program.
* @param ui Deals with the interaction with user.
* @param storage Deals with the loading and updating of file.
* @return The String response of Duke after running command.
public String run(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Command to list all Tasks in the TaskList.
* All the Tasks in TaskList will be printed out to user.
* @param tasks The list that contains all the Tasks on the program.
* @param ui Deals with the interaction with user.
* @param storage Deals with the loading and updating of file.
* @return The String response of Duke after running command.
public String run(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Command to mark a Task as completed.
* @param num The index of Task in TaskList to be marked as completed.
* Task will be updated to completed, data will be updated and saved, message will be printed to user.
* @param tasks The list that contains all the Tasks on the program.
* @param ui Deals with the interaction with user.
* @param storage Deals with the loading and updating of file.
* @return The String response of Duke after running command.
* @throws IOException If there is an error when updating the file.
public String run(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws IOException, DukeException {
throw new DukeException("Task list is currently empty.");
assert this.num >= 0 : "Index of Task to be marked has to be at least 1.";
assert this.num < tasks.getSize() : "Index of Task to be marked has to be less than size of Task list.";
* Command to mark a task as uncompleted.
* @param num The index of Task in TaskList to be marked as uncompleted.
* Task will be updated to uncompleted, data will be updated and saved, message will be printed to user.
* @param tasks The list that contains all the Tasks on the program.
* @param ui Deals with the interaction with user.
* @param storage Deals with the loading and updating of file.
* @return The String response of Duke after running command.
* @throws IOException If there is an error when updating the file.
public String run(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws IOException, DukeException {
throw new DukeException("Task list is currently empty.");
assert this.num >= 0 : "Index of Task to be unmarked has to be at least 1.";
assert this.num < tasks.getSize() : "Index of Task to be unmarked has to be less than size of Task list.";
* Command to update a task's date field.
* @param num The index of Task in TaskList to be deleted.
* Task will be updated in TaskList, data will be updated and saved, message will be printed to user.
* @param tasks The list that contains all the Tasks on the program.
* @param ui Deals with the interaction with user.
* @param storage Deals with the loading and updating of file.
* @return The String response of Duke after running command.
* @throws IOException If there is an error when updating the file.
public String run(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws IOException, DukeException {
throw new DukeException("Task list is empty. There is nothing to update.");
assert this.num >= 0 : "Index of Task to be deleted has to be at least 1.";
assert this.num < tasks.getSize() : "Index of Task to be deleted has to be less than size of Task list.";
